meanings.definition: The art of creating and arranging dance movements.
meanings.sent1: The choreography of the ballet was beautiful and graceful.
meanings.sent2: The dance instructor taught us the choreography for the recital.
meanings.sent3: The choreography of the flash mob surprised everyone in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her choreography of colors in the painting was truly mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The choreography of the synchronized swimmers was like poetry in motion.

meanings.definition: The sequence of steps and movements in a dance or ballet.
meanings.sent1: Learning the choreography for the musical was challenging but fun.
meanings.sent2: The choreography of the tango was intricate and passionate.
meanings.sent3: The choreography of the line dance kept changing, confusing the participants.
meanings.sent4: The choreography of the fight scene in the movie was intense and realistic.
meanings.sent5: The choreography of the cheerleading routine was energetic and dynamic.

meanings.definition: The design and coordination of movements in a performance or show.
meanings.sent1: The choreography of the acrobatic performance was flawless.
meanings.sent2: The marching band practiced their choreography for the halftime show.
meanings.sent3: The choreography of the puppet show made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The choreography of the aerial silk performance was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The choreography of the fashion show was innovative and eye-catching.
